summary: This bill, S. 1577, amends section 1151 of title 14 of the United States Code, modifying restrictions on the construction of Coast Guard vessels in foreign shipyards. It allows for exceptions when in the national security interest, provided the President notifies Congress and certifies specific conditions related to cost, timeline, and shipyard capabilities. The bill also permits the acquisition of completed vessels from foreign shipyards under certain conditions, primarily focusing on member nations of NATO or countries with active US defense treaties in the Indo-Pacific region.
